name: Dinner Tonight: Six Vegetable Soup
description: Like most of my favorite soup recipes, this one comes from Barbara Kafka's Soup: A Way of Life. It couldn't be easier. Plus, since the prime spring vegetables are about a month from appearing in markets, this a great soup for using the heartier winter vegetables. Make sure to add a hefty slug of hot sauce—it really makes every bite pop.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 pound Yukon gold potatoes, peeled, cut into 1/4-inch cubes
3 medium scallions, ends trimmed, thinly sliced

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a medium-sized saucepan set over medium heat. Add onion and cook until translucent, about five minutes.
Add tomatoes and stock, turn heat to high and bring to a boil. Lower heat to medium low and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add potatoes and carrots and simmer for another 15 minutes.
Add the frozen peas, scallions, salt, pinch of black pepper, and a dash of hot sauce. Heat until warmed. Then turn off the heat and serve. Add more salt, black pepper and hot sauce to taste.
